annual crop land: Different shapes and patterns of fields
Natural, irregular boundaries, unlike the straight, geometric lines of buildings
forest: Lack of systematic rows or uniform planting patterns
brushland or shrubland: Lack of buildings, rooflines, and architectural structures
Varied terrain with natural land contours
industrial buildings or commercial build: Location in less densely populated or zoned industrial areas
Roads or paved areas surrounding the structures
pasture land: Minimal human intervention or cultivation patterns
Lack of visible rows or organized planting patterns
Absence of specific horticultural structures (e.g., trellises, crop rows)
visible farming infrastructure (e.g., water troughs, barns)
permanent crop land: Patterns or patches of different crops or vegetation
residential buildings or homes or apartm: Proximity to other residential or urban structures and infrastructure
river: Possible presence of boats, bridges, or docks
lake or sea: Absence of a distinct and noticeable channel or stream
Absence of visible current or flow
